Title: Marketing Manager - Remote - Indeed.com
Description:
PointClickCare is the leading North American cloud-based healthcare software for the acute and long-term and post-acute care markets. For over 20 years, the company has held the same vision – to help the world care for vulnerable populations. Since its inception, PointClickCare has grown exponentially with over 1,700 employees today all working towards impacting the lives of millions. Recognized by Forbes as one of the Top 100 Private Cloud Companies and acknowledged by Waterstone Human Capital as Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Culture, PointClickCare leads the way in creating cloud-based software. With its recent acquisition of Collective Medical, PointClickCare solidifies its position as a high growth healthcare software provider, serving over 21,000 long-term and post-acute care providers and over 1,300 hospitals. Their shared mission to support vulnerable populations is allowing PointClickCare and Collective Medical to connect disparate points of care at scale faster than anyone else in the market.
For more information on PointClickCare, please connect with us on Glassdoor and LinkedIn.
Position Summary:
As a strategic member of the Marketing Team, the Marketing Manager uses market and customer research, competitive intelligence and an in-depth analysis of industry trends to develop effective and actionable marketing strategies and programs for the acute and payor markets. The Marketing Manager is knowledgeable and experienced in the acute and payor market, as well as in identifying and leading digital marketing strategies and plans. This person works closely with members of the Market Leadership, Sales, Customer Success and Marketing teams to ensure internal resources are properly enabled and aligned in executing cross-functional segment strategies and plans.
Key Responsibilities:
Works with Market and Sales leaders, Product Marketing, and other stakeholders to develop and drive execution of end-to-end marketing strategy and programs, applying market insights and setting success criteria.
Drives strategic alignment cross-functionally for go-to-market strategies and positioning.
Develops relationships and liaise with industry-focused associations and third party influencers.
Creates strategic messaging and segment-specific “story telling” narratives, working closely with product marketing to ensure accurate alignment to product vision and positioning, and helping to drive marketing campaigns and programs.
Actively applies subject matter expertise externally in the marketplace through industry speaking engagements, thought leadership content, and other channels.
Responsible for marketing's contribution to pipeline and bookings
Interprets, tracks and reports on industry activity performance, providing insights and recommendations to improve results.
Support marketing, sales and customer success teams on marketing strategy and program education
Creates strategy and messaging for external events including conferences, trade shows and other relevant initiatives.
Responsible for developing and maintaining domain expertise in acute and payor market.
Required Experience:
5+ years industry experience in the Acute and/or Payor space
Strategic level marketing expertise with experience in the SaaS software or technology fields specific to healthcare
Superior written and verbal communication and presentation skills.
Results oriented, with an ability take initiative and drive results with minimal supervision in a highly collaborative environment.
Ability to effectively work under tight deadlines and manage projects independently.
Strong organizational skills and keen attention to detail.
Polished professional who thrives in fast-paced environments, with an ability to adapt to change.
Experienced with digital marketing, integrated campaign management, from the development of an idea through to its execution.
Experienced in building consensus, collaborating with cross groups to get things done.
Experience with working with other disciplines such as PR, marketing programs, trade shows, events and third party influencers.
Willingness to travel up to 25%
Excellent people skills with an upbeat, enthusiastic attitude and a professional maturity suitable for a B2B environment.
Working at PointClickCare goes beyond the resume, because the work we perform makes a true difference in people’s lives. We build innovative healthcare technology for seniors and their caregivers that improve their quality of life and well-being on a daily basis. We believe work is so much more meaningful when you’re doing it with a higher purpose.
For more information on PointClickCare, please visit us on Glassdoor and LinkedIn
#LI-Remote
It is the policy of PointClickCare to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, religion, national origin, status, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital or domestic/civil partnership status, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any other basis protected by law. PointClickCare welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. Please contact recruitment@pointclickcare.com should you require any accommodations.
When you apply for a position, your information is processed and stored with Lever, in accordance with Lever’s Privacy Policy. We use this information to evaluate your candidacy for the posted position. We also store this information, and may use it in relation to future positions to which you apply, or which we believe may be relevant to you given your background. When we have no ongoing legitimate business need to process your information, we will either delete or anonymize it. If you have any questions about how PointClickCare uses or processes your information, or if you would like to ask to access, correct, or delete your information, please contact PointClickCare’s human resources team: recruitment@pointclickcare.com

Title: Graphic Design and Digital Media Specialist - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
About Ryerson
At the intersection of mind and action, Ryerson is on a transformative path to become Canada’s leading comprehensive innovation university. Integral to this path is the placement of equity, diversity and inclusion as fundamental to our institutional culture. Our current academic plan outlines each as core values and we work to embed them in all that we do.
Ryerson University welcomes those who have demonstrated a commitment to upholding the values of equity, diversity, and inclusion and will assist us to expand our capacity for diversity in the broadest sense. In addition, to correct the conditions of disadvantage in employment in Canada, we encourage applications from members of groups that have been historically disadvantaged and marginalized, including First Nations, Metis and Inuit peoples, Indigenous peoples of North America, racialized persons, persons with disabilities, and those who identify as women and/or 2SLGBTQ+. Please note that all qualified candidates are encouraged to apply; however, applications from Canadians and permanent residents will be given priority.
In August 2021, the university announced that it would begin a renaming process to address the legacy of Egerton Ryerson for a more inclusive future. Let's write the next chapter together. To learn more about our work environment, colleagues, leaders, students and innovative educational environment
The team
Our team is passionate, highly productive and a lot of fun! Lead by the director, administration and operations communications and manager, communications administration and operations, you will also be working alongside three communication specialists, a web developer and another graphic design and digital media specialist.
We’re committed to providing our clients with high quality, creative, timely and effective communications that enhance workplace culture, engagement and inclusion. Our team is very inclusion focused, we have regular team discussions dedicated to themes of equity, diversity and inclusion. These themes are at the forefront of our decision-making.
Currently, our team is working remotely and the future of work at Ryerson is hybrid as the university transitions to a flexible work experience. Some on-campus activity may be required.
The Opportunity
Reporting to the manager, administration and operations communications with leadership from the director, you’ll be responsible for designing and executing communications materials with specific responsibility for graphic design and digital media, ensuring alignment with university branding standards, communications strategies and adhering to high accessibility standards.
Working with our team and departments under Administration and Operations, you play an important role in our success:
You will be responsible for designing and developing graphic design elements and layout for all communications materials, including presentations, posters, display/event material, advertisements, signage, video, animated GIFs, infographics.
You’ll work within the parameters of the university branding standards, accessibility standards and university communications strategies. The team will turn to you for expertise and advice on Ryerson’s branding standards.
You will play a key role by building and sending HTML emails. You will work closely with the web developer to create email layouts.
You will assist the web developer in updating and maintaining multiple websites. You will be responsible for using your design expertise to inform web layouts that use bright photos and dynamic content for optimal user experience.
You will take photographs on an as-needed basis for publications or web. You will also coordinate with any external photographers and videographers, including responsibility for bookings, shot list, ensuring photos are on brand and fit the needs of our websites, emails, print materials.
You’ll be able to confidently use your project management skills to execute communications projects, ensuring the quality of images, photography, video, graphic composition, file format and printing where applicable. This includes implementing a variety of media including websites, HTML emails, digital screen content, print materials, etc.
You will work closely with the University Business Services portfolio in particular, providing marketing insight to promote their student-focused services and products.
Qualifications
To help us learn more about you, please provide a cover letter and resume describing how you meet the following required qualifications:
Degree or diploma program in Graphic Design or Digital Media;
Minimum of two (2) to three (3) years of experience with theoretical, conceptual and practical skills in graphic design, layout and composition, web design, photography, typography, illustration, print production, audio/visual;
Proficiency in graphic design and photo/video software (Adobe Creative Cloud including InDesign, Illustrator, Photoshop and Premiere Pro) and experience with the use of photography and video equipment.
Technical skills to execute communications in a variety of media, including using web content management systems, email marketing software and other social media technology.
Current knowledge of industry standards and new technology and design techniques, as well as accessibility best practices and AODA principles.
Competency in social media, specifically Twitter, Instagram and LinkedIn.
Some past experience in marketing is preferred.
This position also requires the following: creativity, sound understanding of design principles and communication theory, good time management skills, interpersonal skills, ability to meet deadlines, a thorough understanding of new media.
Additional Information
Position Number(s)
20004090
Reports To
Manager, Administration and Operations Communications
Vacancy Type
TERM
Employee Group
MAC
Work Location
Hybrid
Start Date
January 17, 2022
End Date
Approximately 18 months from the start date
Hours of Work
36.25
Grade and Step
C42
Salary Scale
$66,045 - 105,500 (hiring range: $66,045 - $85,772)
HR Advisor
Renee Gordon
Application Close Date
Dec 1, 2021
We encourage all First Nations, Metis and Inuit peoples or Indigenous peoples of North America, to self-identify in their applications and also reach out to Tracey King, Indigenous Human Resources Lead for support during the selection process.
As part of the selection process, candidates may be required to complete an occupational assessment.
Qualified MAC employees will be interviewed before members of other employee groups.
An equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered.
Applications will only be accepted online through Ryerson's careersite.
Ryerson University is committed to the principles of the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA), and aims to ensure that independence, dignity, integration and equality of opportunity are embedded in all aspects of the university culture.
We will provide an accessible experience for applicants, students, employees, and members of the Ryerson community.We are committed to providing an inclusive and barrier-free work environment, beginning with the recruitment process. If you have restrictions that need to be accommodated to fully participate in any phase of the recruitment process, please contact hr@ryerson.ca. All information received in relation to accommodation will be kept confidential.
.
Important Notice Re: Job Postings during COVID-19
Following the advice of government and health authorities to slow the spread of COVID-19, all employees have been equipped to work from home until further notice. New employees will also work from home with the exception of those who have been deemed 'essential' and are required to be on campus. All recruiting activities including interviews and onboarding are being conducted virtually.
To protect the health and safety of community members on campus and to comply with the recommendations from public health authorities and requirements of the provincial government, Ryerson, like other post-secondary institutions in Ontario, will require employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and submit proof of vaccination.

Title: Marketing Assistant Intern - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
4 month internship starting in May 2022
ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES
This individual will gain on-hands experience in category management and the distribution business in B2B in sector. They will collaborate with the category management team and related cross-functional teams to help develop and execute marketing programs and promotions. They will use data-driven analysis to optimize results and identify opportunities.
JOB ACTIVITIES
Assist with building and executing the Monthly Sales Flyer.
Prepare and submit digital marketing requests through the marketing tool.
Assist in reviewing and approving marketing programs for final execution.
Lead the in-store merchandising programs by working closely with the Category Managers, Associate Category Managers and Supplier partners.
Work with the Marketing Communication team on printed catalogs.
Assemble insights and data from marketing programs and promotions.
Communicate promotions and program to the sales team.
Help review product assortment for correct product category, product description, and make recommendations for improvement.
Other duties as assigned.
YOU MUST HAVE
You are a college student or enrolled in a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Communication/Marketing.
WE VALUE
Attention to detail and analytic skills.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to work in a high-pressure environment.
Organization and time management skills.
Ability to multitask and take initiative.
Team-oriented but can work independently as needed.
Ability to take direction and absorb information quickly.
About Us: Resideo is a leading global provider of critical comfort and security solutions primarily in residential environments and distributor of low-voltage electronic and security products. Building on a 130-year heritage, Resideo has a presence in more than 150 million homes, with 15 million systems installed in homes each year. We continue to serve more than 110,000 professionals through leading distributors, including our ADI Global Distribution business, which exports to more than 100 countries from more than 200 stocking locations around the world. Resideo is a $5.0 billion company with approximately 13,000 global employees. For more information about Resideo, please visit www.resideo.com .
At Resideo, we bring together diverse individuals to build the future of homes. Resideo is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

Title: Digital Marketing Coordinator - Toronto - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Please apply on Isarta.com
https://jobs.isarta.com/cgi-bin/emplois/pm.cgi?action=display&login=71457&utm_source=IND
Company Description
Oliver & Bonacini is recognized as one of Canada's leading hospitality companies, operating a variety of unique and innovative restaurants, event venues and catering in Ontario, Quebec, Saskatchewan and Alberta. O&B credits its success to the development of a strong corporate culture, where excellence of food quality and service are valued above all else.
The marketing team at O&B is a dynamic group of creative professionals who specialize in all areas of marketing, including digital marketing, public relations, social media, graphic design, photography, guest relations and more. With a focus on collaboration and producing exceptional work, we work together to achieve company goals and objectives, while identifying new opportunities that will help set O&B apart in the food and hospitality industry.
While we are currently working remotely, this position would eventually be based out of our midtown head office.
Job Description
This entry-level position involves working with a cross-functional team, and will provide the opportunities to learn about and experience a variety of marketing tactics from the ground up. Under the supervision of the Digital Marketing Manager, the Digital Marketing Coordinator will work closely with the Digital team to maintain company websites and profiles, assist with email marketing initiatives, develop SEO-driven content and analyze results against company objectives. The ideal candidate will have a passion for digital marketing and the restaurant and hospitality industry.
Digital Content Creation/Strategy
Perform keyword, industry and competitive research to inform digital content marketing strategy, and create high-quality content around relevant terms and trends
Audit and maintain company websites and profiles including responsibilities such as: ensuring all content is up-to-date, accurate, and follows brand guidelines; implementing website best practices; optimizing media and content; tracking analytics; assisting with new site planning and content development
Implement on-page and off-page optimization, analyze competitors, perform keyword research, and identify link building opportunities
Conduct listing audits to ensure citations are accurate and optimized - creating, claiming and verifying new listings
Perform website content updates and write news and blog posts designed to drive traffic, promote engagement and support company objectives
Stay up-to-date on industry changes and identify new technologies to improve processes
Email Marketing
Contribute to O&B's email marketing initiatives, from strategy and development, to execution of email campaigns in Mailchimp
Update and maintain the email marketing calendar and reporting spreadsheet
Research and seek opportunities for growing O&B's email database and newsletter signups
Strategy/Digital Reporting
Summarize and gather ongoing insights to optimize campaign performance
Provide reporting on all digital activities and campaigns, including insights and assessment against identified goals
Qualifications
Post-secondary education with a degree or diploma in digital marketing, business or communications
Knowledge of content management systems, email marketing programs (Wordpress, Mailchimp, etc.) and HTML
Google Analytics Certification is an asset
Google Ads Certifications are an asset
Understanding of SEO best practices and strategies
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Detail-oriented and strong organizational skills
Works extremely well under pressure and is able to multitask on concurrent projects
Enjoys working in a hands-on and collaborative team environment
Passionate about food and the hospitality industry
Additional Information
** We thank all applicants for their interest in Oliver & Bonacini; however, only suitable candidates will be contacted to continue the application process. **

Title: Specialist, Marketing - Calgary, AB - Indeed.com
Description:
ABOUT OUR COMPANY
“Powering Economies and Communities”
TransAlta owns, operates, and develops a diverse fleet of electrical generation assets in Canada, the United States and Australia, providing municipalities, industries and businesses with safe, low-cost and reliable clean electricity.
For over 100 years, TransAlta has been a responsible operator and proud community-member where its employees work and live. We are committed to fostering a dynamic, productive, and safe work environment. Our employees contribute to a diverse, open, and transparent culture with clear accountabilities, strong leadership, and challenging opportunities for personal career growth.
For more information about TransAlta, visit our website at, www.transalta.com
ABOUT THE ROLE
We are looking for an experienced and motivated Marketing Specialist to join our Corporate Communications team. Reporting directly to the Manager of Corporate Communications, you are accountable for maintaining the public image and brand of the organization, generating leads for the business, and building strategies and campaigns that boost awareness and create meaningful engagements with prospects and customers. You must demonstrate proven experience in developing and implementing effective marketing and communications plans, identifying audiences, creating engaging marketing and sales content, and tracking results to enhance the reputation of TransAlta.
ACCOUNTABILITIES
Partner with a variety of business unit stakeholders, such as sales and business development, for lead generation opportunities by delivering a program of key marketing collateral and campaigns in line with the business unit objectives and priorities related to customer retention and acquisition
Analyze and improve the customer journey on multiple platforms (ad campaigns, website, social media, etc.)
Develop marketing strategies and messaging, ensuring content, marketing and sales collateral and value proposition are consistent across all channels
Prepare thoughtful, high-impact, and engaging marketing and sales collateral that highlight our depth of experience, expertise, and creativity – out of the box thinking is encouraged to position TransAlta as a clean energy provider
Provide superior writing and editing services; including but not limited to marketing plans, briefing notes, publications, portal stories, external corporate website stories, marketing and sales collateral
Contribute to the company’s digital communications platforms (web and social media) to advance the business unit(s) marketing objectives and contribute proof points to the company’s strategic priorities
Act as a brand ambassador externally and ensure reputation and brand principles are upheld internally and externally
Develop and implement advertising campaigns and collateral to support conferences, tradeshows and community engagement events
Contribute to TransAlta’s suite of internal and external communications assets while supporting the broader strategy of the Communications team
ABOUT YOU
Degree in marketing, digital marketing, business, communications, or public relations
Seven to ten years of progressive and relevant work experience is preferred
Agency experience is preferred
Demonstrated senior copywriting and editing abilities
Proven experience leading corporate marketing campaigns and collateral creation projects
Demonstrated experience leveraging earned, owned, and paid media to advance organizational goals
Attention to detail and an eye for quality with the ability to identify key messages and distill complex information into concise and effective communications materials
Strong time management skills and ability to work effectively under pressure, meet tight deadlines, prioritize and deal with uncertainty in a fast-paced environment
Strong analytical skills including ability to identify communication needs and align varying perspectives to ensure consistency in overall communications perspective and strategy
Knowledge and experience in digital media content development and marketing
Demonstrated proficiency with Microsoft Office and Adobe Creative Suite
Some knowledge of the energy or electricity sector(s) is preferred
Apply today to join the TransAlta team! We look forward to reviewing your application.
Our commitment is to attract and retain the best talent. Some positions may require the successful completion of one or more background checks such as criminal, medical, or compliance. If these verifications are needed, they will be indicated on the job posting.
COVID-19 VACCINATION POLICY
As TransAlta continues to navigate through unprecedented challenges from the COVID-19 pandemic, we want to assure prospective employees of our continued commitment to maintaining a safe and healthy workplace and that we are taking additional measures to help protect our employees and their families from contracting and spreading COVID-19.
All employees hired, or who begin employment, after November 15, 2021 must provide proof of full vaccination as a condition of employment. Those applicants with appropriate exemptions must identify themselves at the time of interview and provide documentation of the exemption to the TransAlta Disability Management team prior to an offer of employment being made.
Our Commitment to Equality, Diversity, and Inclusion:
It is our collective mission to ensure that every single employee feels a sense of inclusion and belonging and can show up to work as their true authentic self. TransAlta is committed to hiring a diverse workforce including women, Indigenous Peoples, persons with disabilities, members of visible minorities, and members of the LGBTQ2+ community. TransAlta believes that diversity enhances the quality of its performance, is an essential element to effective corporate governance, and cultivates a strong workplace culture. Click here for our Diversity and Inclusion Pledge.
TransAlta has received certification from Diversio, a technology company setting the global standard for equity, diversity, and inclusion, for its continued commitment to and meaningful performance on ED&I in the workplace.

Title: Digital Marketing Manager - Remote - Indeed.com
Description:
It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing!
We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.
We are looking for experienced, innovative and results-oriented Digital Marketing Manager to join our global GTM team and support company’s aggressive growth targets. This role will be responsible for designing, executing and measuring digital campaigns as a part of the integrated campaign approach that will result in pipeline creation. This will include project management, build, QA, deployment, testing, and reporting. The ideal candidate for this role will have analytical mindset and a proven track record of driving programs that acquire new logos and drive retention and experience leveraging digital channels including email, virtual events, paid social, organic social, and others.
Job Responsibilities:
Plan and execute digital marketing campaigns using digital channels such as email, paid social, paid search and display ads
Create landing pages that drive conversions and optimize the user experience
Optimize chatbot playbooks
Develop and implement retargeting campaigns
Support deployment of high-impact email campaigns that drive pipeline creation
Continuously improve conversion optimization and run A/B tests
Manage digital campaign budget
Deliver clear and consistent communication with Field teams to ensure alignment on strategy, tactics, goals, and performance for digital channels
Identify digital trends and insights that will optimize spend and performance
Measure and report performance of all digital marketing campaigns and assess against goals
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Marketing or related
5 years of B2B digital marketing experience
Experience creating and executing lead/pipeline generation campaigns
Experience with paid and unpaid LinkedIn ads
Experience managing PPC campaigns
Experience with Google Analytics
Experience with chatbots strongly preferred
Experience with CRM (SFDC) and Marketing Automation systems (Pardot highly preferred)
Knowledge of modern MarTech stack
Self-motivated with a passion for understanding customer behavior and conversion rate optimization
Data-driven with a proven track record in optimizing marketing campaigns to improve CTR and/or conversion rate
Excellent interpersonal, written and oral communication skills
Proficiency with Microsoft applications including Word, Excel and Powerpoint
Kyriba Culture and Values
At Kyriba, we value a strong work culture and sense of community and ownership among our global team. We live by our “iCare” value system to demonstrate our care and commitment to our clients and to each other. In hiring, we look for candidates that are a strong fit with our culture and values, as well as bring the talent and experience required by the position.
Innovation
: We foster innovation and entrepreneurial thinking across our team by rewarding employees for their achievements and encouraging efficiency and continual process improvement.
Client Success:
Our passion is to enable our clients’ success. We do this by understanding their needs, and developing and managing solutions that provide them the insight to effectively drive decision making within their organizations.
Accountability:
We each take personal responsibility for our actions. We are committed to our own continuous improvement and we go the extra mile to meet our clients' needs.
Respect:
We respect each other’s ideas, efforts and commitments, and embrace our diverse cultures and points of view. We achieve our goals through teamwork, responsiveness, open communication and a positive attitude.
Excellence:
We strive for excellence in all that we do and bring the passion and commitment to deliver on our promises. We achieve excellence through leadership, teamwork, transparency and integrity, and we are committed to recognizing employee achievements.
Kyriba believes that everyone has the ability to make an impact, and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to providing employment opportunity regardless of sex, race, creed, color, gender, religion, marital status, domestic partner status, age, national origin or ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, pregnancy, military or veteran status, citizenship status, and genetic information.
Kyriba believes that everyone has the ability to make an impact, and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to providing employment opportunity regardless of sex, race, creed, color, gender, religion, marital status, domestic partner status, age, national origin or ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, pregnancy, military or veteran status, citizenship status, and genetic information.

Title: Digital Marketer - Edmonton, AB - Indeed.com
Description:
Digital Marketing Specialist
About us
Wild TV is a company in ARTS_ENTERTAINMENT_RECREATION in Edmonton, AB. We are customer-centric, challenging, and professional.
Our work environment includes:
Casual work attire
Regular social events
Flexible working hours
Wild TV is looking for a highly-motivated and creative Marketing Specialist to help take our
company to the next level. Do you think outside of the box? Do you have a strong background in digital marketing? Do you understand Paid Search? Paid Social? Organic Social? Ad words?
Are you a great speller? An amazing communicator?
Are you able to evaluate and optimize digital marketing campaigns? Can you help us improve
lead generation and our use of Hubspot? Do you have an eye for design? Do you dream about data driven-marketing results? If so.... read on!
Overview:
We are a television company with four distinct Canadian Speciality channels: Wild TV (Hunting), Water Network (water-related activities), RFD-TV (rural/agriculture), The Cowboy Channel Canada (western lifestyle). We have recently launched the Wild TV Canada APP, a
subscription-based VOD app. We have extensive depth and experience in promoting our
channels through conventional means. We are looking for a team member who can help us be exceptional, and strengthen our digital marketing efforts.
The successful candidate will be responsible for collaborating, creating, developing, and
executing marketing strategies and initiatives for our channels, including the Wild TV Canada
APP.
You should have an intimate knowledge of how to plan and execute campaigns on Facebook,
Instagram, LinkedIn, Twitter, Pinterest, and others. You should have a passion for testing digital creative, targeting interests, geo-targeting, and creating lookalike audiences. You will need a good understanding of analytics and how to use data to optimize marketing spend and maximize lead generation.
You will be a subject matter expert in marketing-related activities that help us increase advertising sales along with APP and cable/satellite subscribers.
Job Description:
 Develop ROI-generating concepts and present to key decision-makers
 Plan, coordinate and work with cross-functional teams to implement marketing
strategies for B2B and B2C product portfolios across all companies
 Administer tracking and evaluation of campaigns
 Review and evaluate existing marketing practices, and seek new promotional
opportunities
 Consult and collaborate with internal departments including the executive team,
programming, production, sales, and finance to coordinate and execute
marketing strategies
 Develop and coordinate collateral to support the sales team
 Manage project budgets
 Leverage our media value to drive co-marketing efforts with producers and
manufacturers
Qualifications, experience and background:
You should have 3 to 5 years of sales-focused marketing experience with a focus on
executing digital campaigns. Digital agency experience is an asset. Knowledge of hunting
and the hunting industry is an asset.
You will need to have the following skills in your tool kit:

Title: Intern - Sales & Marketing analyst - Laval, QC - Indeed.com
Description:
Site Name:
Canada - Quebec - Laval
Posted Date:
Nov 1 2021
Key Accountabilities/Minimum Requirements
Accountable for a high powered, data driven streamlined performance reporting and related insight generation. Effectively partnering with marketing and sales leads in driving performance and insight generation
Preferred advanced degree student in business and/or science (MBA, MSc/PhD, MBiotech, etc.)
Highly proficient in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint
Experience in Data Analytics
Strong affinity and interest in Management, Sales and Marketing
Experience in Commercial Pharmaceuticals, Knowledge of products and services are an asset
Demonstrated ability to work effectively independently and in a cross functional team environment
Highly agile learner with a solution-based mindset, able to assimilate and prioritize a broad range of business issues and needs associated with multiple stakeholders within the organization
Ability to synthesize large amounts data from various sources and to effectively present major themes
Strong communication and influencing skills to ensure an objective representation of ideas and opinions
Responsibilities (what will your student do?)
Collection, analysis and insight creation from Sales and Marketing data :
External Health Care Professional and consumer insights from Voice of the Customer reports
Sales Performance: collate, Quality Check and send out weekly and monthly reports
Support performance analysis and insight creation: Analyse and summarize Weekly and Monthly performance data to understand trends, generate key insights and root causes of problems
Execute Ad hoc analyses:
Use IQVIA IAM, SOB report, automated MPR report, CBID, and other data sources to answer questions from stakeholders
Support the development, implementation and on-going optimization of new digital marketing initiatives
Work closely with the Business Intelligence Team to best leverage available data and reports and to drive continuous improvement of those in function of evolving business needs
LI-GSK
GSK is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We welcome applications from all qualified individuals to apply to our career opportunities. GSK is committed to accommodating persons with disabilities. If you need accommodation at any stage of the application process or want more information on our accommodation policies, please contact us at canada-recruitment@gsk.com. Please do not send resumes to this e-mail and instead apply through the online application process of this posting.
As a health and science-based organization, GSK is committed to following the recommendations as set out by Health Canada and taking all necessary steps to help curb the spread of COVID-19 which includes getting the COVID-19 vaccine. We feel strongly that this is the best way to help protect those we value most: our employees, families, communities and the patients and consumers we serve. To that end, we are taking an important step to ensure the safety of our employees during this global public health crisis.
Only employees who are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 may attend our Mississauga and Laval corporate offices. In addition, all customer-facing employees who, as part of their job, attend healthcare settings such as hospitals, pharmacies, doctors’ offices and dentists’ offices will need to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Notwithstanding the foregoing, employees may seek an accommodation for human rights-related reasons, including medical or disability-related conditions, or religious beliefs.
Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies
GSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. Title: Digital Marketing & Communications Specialist - Markham, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Love selling a brand? Love helping people? We need you! Our company is looking for a motivated self-starter who is passionate about marketing, social media, communications, and connecting people to join our dynamic and fast-growing real estate organization in Markham, Ontario.
Experience in a Real Estate Office preferred!
This position will be responsible for generating traffic to new and existing homes for sale by creating and delivering marketing ideas and activities; creating content and managing social media channels; maintaining inventory of collateral materials; planning client and community events, meetings, and trade shows; developing and maintaining our relationships within our community.
A portion of this position may include some basic office administration as required.
You will be involved in helping our staff communicate the value we bring to the community.
Compensation:
$38,000 - $48,000 yearly
Responsibilities:
Streamline company materials and campaigns to ensure a consistent and concise message
Create, deliver and edit marketing materials and advertising campaigns that are effective and timely
Executes new listing launch including digital and print marketing packages
Prepares weekly sales reports
Edits and maintains social content for communities
Post and maintain all listings in MLS
Coordinate all services for listings (Home Cleaners, Sign Installation, Home Stagers, etc.)
Manage website design, content, SEO development, and tracking analytics to ensure all content is up to date and relevant
Run and maintain all social media channels (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc.) with scheduled posts and updates
Event Planning and Coordination
Create and Edit Photos
Create and Edit Video
Establish all marketing for team events, open houses, and new listings
Plan and organize all team events and market across all social media channels
Qualifications:
Independent and self-motivated
Great communicator, proficient at creative writing
Real Estate Experience
5+ Years of professional marketing experience
Ability to communicate effectively (oral and written)
Experience using design programs such as Adobe, Canva, Photoshop, Video Editing Software
Be a team player who thrives working with a tight-knit company where their activities directly affect the bottom line
About Company
We specialize in buying and selling real estate in Markham and Stouffville. Located in the historic Main Street Unionville and established in 2012, As a small and tight-knit bunch, each member of the staff is united because they all share the same values. With a mission in real estate and a passion for helping people, we truly enjoy helping families in their real estate journey to finding their dream home. It's not just about the sale, it's about building a lifelong relationship.

Title: Digital Marketing - Calgary, AB - Indeed.com
Description:
Our furniture store is looking to hire for a part-time or full-time position. We are looking for a very organized person to help in our mattress and furniture store. We sell and ship Canada-wide; the place can get quite busy and the job is very high paced. The ability to multitask and learn quickly is very important.
The current opening is primarily to take over the marketing department. For full time applicants the majority of the time would be spent creating online ads, managing our online presence, as well as creating graphics for print. The secondary part of a full time employee would be to help with sales. We are a smaller company and we help each other out where needed so some flexibility is considered an asset. There is plenty of room to grow with the company and take on new responsibilities as we grow if one so wishes.
Skills required:
-Computers - Work with MS Word, Excel, Outlook, troubleshoot printers computers, graphics for marketing purposes. Good knowledge of marketing avenues.
-Customer service - Always provide outstanding customer service, constantly interacting with customers, out-bound and in-bound customer calls.
-Sales – Experience an asset. Help sell Mattresses, furniture, other products as well, etc.
-Ability to do shipping and receiving is considered an asset. Preferably be able to load and unload trucks and lift up to 50lbs (lifting 100lbs is an asset)
The company operates 6 days a week, so the applicant must be able to work on week-ends with the possibility of rotating shifts.
There are multiple companies operated out of the one store so the successful applicant will have to learn about them.
Pay will be based on experience and performance.
If you believe this is you... Please send us your resume and let us know why as well you would be a good fit in the letter.
Part-time hours: 20-45 per week
Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Permanent
Salary: $16.00-$20.00 per hour
Experience:
Digital marketing: 1 year (preferred)
Graphic design: 1 year (preferred)
Advertising: 1 year (preferred)
Social Media: 1 year (preferred)
Sales: 1 year (preferred)
Customer Service: 1 year (preferred)
Licence/Certification:
Class 5 Driver's License (preferred)
Work remotely:
No

Title: Digital Marketing Coordinator - Halifax, NS - Indeed.com
Description:
Founded in 1982 by members of the Armoyan family, Armco Capital Inc. (Armco) has grown from a small business into a diversified and dynamic group of companies. Establishing a strong reputation as one of Eastern Canada’s most prominent real estate developers with properties in Nova Scotia, New Brunswick, Quebec, Atlanta, Florida and Texas.
We are searching for a Digital Marketing Coordinator to join our team in either our Halifax or Montreal location.
As the successful candidate, you will be responsible for creating, updating and maintaining company websites and social media for our group of companies. This includes creating content, keeping the sites current and on trend. You will work with others in the organization to ensure the information/marketing is current and raising brand/company awareness.
As the successful candidate, you will be a self-starter, creative, out of box thinker with excellent communication skills both verbal and written. While education is important so is experience so we are looking for either a degree, diploma in marketing, communications or related field, and/or equivalent working experience. As well, you will have experience managing multiple projects, websites, social media platforms and other digital marketing.
If you are confident that you would be a good fit for our team, please send a resume and cover letter.
We thank all candidates who are interested in this position but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
Fondée en 1982 par des membres de la famille Armoyan, Armco Capital Inc. (Armco) est passée d'une petite entreprise à un groupe d'entreprises diversifié et dynamique. Établir une solide réputation comme l'un des promoteurs immobiliers les plus importants de l'Est du Canada avec des propriétés en Nouvelle-Écosse, au Nouveau-Brunswick, au Québec, à Atlanta, en Floride et au Texas.
Nous recherchons un coordonnateur du marketing numérique pour se joindre à notre équipe à Halifax ou à Montréal.
En tant que candidat retenu , vous serez responsable de la création, de la mise à jour et de la maintenance des sites Web de l'entreprise et des médias sociaux pour notre groupe d'entreprises. Cela comprend la création de contenu, le maintien des sites à jour et tendance . Vous travaillerez avec d'autres membres de l'organisation pour vous assurer que l'information /le marketing sont à jour et qu'ils font connaître la marque /l'entreprise .
Le candidat retenu, vous serez un auto - démarrage, créatif, de penseur boîte avec d' excellentes aptitudes en communication verbale et écrite. Alors que l' éducation est importante est si l' expérience de sorte que nous recherchons soit un grade, un diplôme en m arketing, c ommunication ou dans un domaine connexe et / ou expérience de travail équivalente. De plus, vous aurez de l' expérience dans la gestion de plusieurs projets, sites Web, plateformes de médias sociaux et autre marketing numérique.
Si vous êtes convaincu que vous seriez un bon candidat pour notre équipe, veuillez envoyer un CV et une lettre de motivation.
Nous remercions tous les candidats intéressés par ce poste mais seulement ceux
sélectionnés pour une entrevue seront contactés.
Job Type: Full-time
Work remotely:
No

Title: VP Marketing - Montréal, QC - Indeed.com
Description:
What's the opportunity?
Are you passionate about customer acquisition, growth and data? Are you a bilingual digital marketer who has managed user acquisition channels at a fintech/insurtech or B2C startup?
We're hiring a VP of Marketing who will manage a $500k annual marketing budget to generate at least $1 million in annual recurring revenue and help us transform the insurance industry to be more affordable and transparent for all.
What we're building
Allset is disrupting the insurance industry with technology, data and human expertise. We are on a mission to help our users buy the best insurance according to their real needs, in complete transparency.
We're growing fast and we're looking for a talented VP of Marketing to help us grow even faster. To date, we've helped over 30 000 Canadians shop for their home and car insurance with an average of 4.9 stars in online reviews.
Our powerful technology connects to 10+ insurance companies to help you save 29% on average, in less than 4 minutes, online.
What will you be responsible for?
Defining and leading the growth and retention strategy for the company with the support of the management team.
Growing our user base across Canada through Facebook Ads campaigns and other scalable marketing channels to ensure continuous optimization of CAC/LTV ratio.
Being our first full-time marketer with resources to hire key internal and external individuals to build our marketing team around you as we grow.
What type of person are you?
Results-oriented: you're focused on your growth objectives and work steadily to achieve them.
Motivated: you're entrepreneurial and you don't hesitate to roll up your sleeves with a “let's get it done” attitude.
Analytical: you love experimenting, base decisions on data and can quickly connect the insights to make decisions.
Do you have what it takes?
You are a digital marketer with 5-10 years of experience, having successfully managed user acquisition channels such as Facebook ads, SEM, SEO, affiliate marketing and email marketing.
You have strong written and oral communication skills in French and English.
You have strong technical capability with in-depth understanding of digital marketing tools, including Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager.
You are motivated to come build the future of insurance with us!
What's in it for you?
Competitive compensation with stock options
Build something massive and create an impact
Flexible hours and vacations
Remote work or downtown Montreal office space
Flexible start date (but the sooner the better!)
This opportunity is for a full-time position in a high-growth startup, with increasing responsibilities, including leading and growing the marketing team of the company.
